meanings.definition: To exert force on something in order to move it or cause it to be moved.
meanings.sent1: She had to press the button to open the door.
meanings.sent2: The workers press the lever to start the machine.
meanings.sent3: Trying to press a cat into a small box is not a good idea.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the world seemed to press down on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind began to press against the windows.

meanings.definition: A machine or device used to apply pressure or force in order to flatten, shape, or compress something.
meanings.sent1: The tailor used a press to iron the shirt.
meanings.sent2: The factory has a large press for molding metal parts.
meanings.sent3: The sandwich press made a funny noise when it was turned on.
meanings.sent4: The press of the stamping machine echoed through the workshop.
meanings.sent5: The hydraulic press slowly flattened the metal sheet.

meanings.definition: A group of journalists or news organizations collectively.
meanings.sent1: The press gathered outside the courthouse for the trial.
meanings.sent2: The local press covered the community event extensively.
meanings.sent3: The press joked about the mayor's funny hat at the press conference.
meanings.sent4: The press uncovered a scandal that shook the political world.
meanings.sent5: The press room buzzed with excitement before the announcement.
